Unit 1 HTML & CSS - Goals

  • Structure pages with HTML5 and style them with CSS3
    • Couldn't use bootstrap or other CSS framework.
    • Write CSS & HTML from scratch.
    • Semantics - W3 Validation. i.e. SEO & accessibility

The way I was writing code was not valid.

Tips:

  • CanIUse.com
  • Jade - template engine.
CSS Specificity an overall low specificity for code re-use
  • (0,0,0,1) <--element selector 
    p {color: red}
  • (0,0,1,0)<--class selector 
    .red {color: red}
CSS Specificity - continued
  • (0, 1,0,0)<--ID selector 
    #red {color: red}
CSS Specificity - example
  • (1, 0,0,0)<--in-line selector 
    <p style="color: red;">red</p>
    • Link
    • Example

Code our styles with pre-processors instead of direct CSS changes.

Pre-processors like SASS, Less, or Stylus means writing less CSS code AND the ability to write your css more expressively.

  • Variables
  • Nesting
  • Importing

Variables
-CSS
body {
  font: 100% Helvetica, sans-serif;
  color: #333;
}
- SASS 
$font-stack:    Helvetica, sans-serif;
$primary-color: #333;

body {
  font: 100% $font-stack;
  color: $primary-color;
}
  • Nesting - CSS 
    nav ul {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  list-style: none;
}

nav li {
  display: inline-block;
}
nav a {text-decoration: none;}
  • Nesting - SASS 
    nav {
  ul {
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
    list-style: none;
  }
  li { display: inline-block; }
  a {text-decoration: none; }
}

Unit 2 Javascript & Github
    • Learn to use Version Control
    • gh-pages- Host static pages on github
    • $ git checkout -b gh-pages // go to the gh-pages branch or create one.
$ git rebase master // bring gh-pages up to date with master
$ git push origin gh-pages // commit the changes
$ git checkout master // return to the master branch
